oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Dr. Frank F. Drowota, Jr., 1980 November 20, excerpt 06
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville minister Dr. Frank F. Drowota, Jr., conducted on 20 November 1980 by Helen Drowota as part of the Century III Nashville: Nashville Heritage Project. Drowota, a native of England and the founding minister of Nashville's Woodmont Christian Church, discusses the divisive affect of the Vietnam War on the church, including such issues as ministering to deserters who had fled to Canada and whether or not the war was justified. The complete interview, as well as an index, is available in the repository.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Drowota, Frank F., 1904-1998--Interviews
